channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Constant in HATE: Analyzing Toxicity in Reddit across Topics and Languages
item.description: Toxic language remains an ongoing challenge on social media platforms, presenting significant issues for users and communities.

item.title: Analyzing Semantic Change through Lexical Replacements
item.description: Furthermore, we leverage the replacement schema as a basis for a novel \textit{interpretable} model for semantic change.

item.title: Efficiency-Effectiveness Tradeoff of Probabilistic Structured Queries for Cross-Language Information Retrieval
item.description: Probabilistic Structured Queries (PSQ) is a cross-language information retrieval (CLIR) method that uses translation probabilities statistically derived from aligned corpora.

item.title: More RLHF, More Trust? On The Impact of Human Preference Alignment On Language Model Trustworthiness
item.description: The surge in Large Language Models (LLMs) development has led to improved performance on cognitive tasks as well as an urgent need to align these models with human values in order to safely exploit their power.

item.title: Efficient Inverted Indexes for Approximate Retrieval over Learned Sparse Representations
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel organization of the inverted index that enables fast yet effective approximate retrieval over learned sparse embeddings.

item.title: RSCaMa: Remote Sensing Image Change Captioning with State Space Model
item.description: Experimental results validate the effectiveness of CaMa layers and demonstrate the superior performance of RSCaMa, as well as the potential of Mamba in the RSICC task.

item.title: Enhancing Boundary Segmentation for Topological Accuracy with Skeleton-based Methods
item.description: Topological consistency plays a crucial role in the task of boundary segmentation for reticular images, such as cell membrane segmentation in neuron electron microscopic images, grain boundary segmentation in material microscopic images and road segmentation in aerial images.

item.title: SIDBench: A Python Framework for Reliably Assessing Synthetic Image Detection Methods
item.description: The generative AI technology offers an increasing variety of tools for generating entirely synthetic images that are increasingly indistinguishable from real ones.

item.title: 3AM: An Ambiguity-Aware Multi-Modal Machine Translation Dataset
item.description: Experimental results show that MMT models trained on our dataset exhibit a greater ability to exploit visual information than those trained on other MMT datasets.

item.title: BMRetriever: Tuning Large Language Models as Better Biomedical Text Retrievers
item.description: Developing effective biomedical retrieval models is important for excelling at knowledge-intensive biomedical tasks but still challenging due to the deficiency of sufficient publicly annotated biomedical data and computational resources.

item.title: Benchmarking Benchmark Leakage in Large Language Models
item.description: By analyzing 31 LLMs under the context of mathematical reasoning, we reveal substantial instances of training even test set misuse, resulting in potentially unfair comparisons.

item.title: Uncertainty-boosted Robust Video Activity Anticipation
item.description: Video activity anticipation aims to predict what will happen in the future, embracing a broad application prospect ranging from robot vision and autonomous driving.

item.title: Semantic Line Combination Detector
item.description: A novel algorithm, called semantic line combination detector (SLCD), to find an optimal combination of semantic lines is proposed in this paper.

item.title: Going Beyond Popularity and Positivity Bias: Correcting for Multifactorial Bias in Recommender Systems
item.description: Debiasing methods aim to mitigate the effect of selection bias on the evaluation and optimization of RSs.

item.title: FlexiFilm: Long Video Generation with Flexible Conditions
item.description: Generating long and consistent videos has emerged as a significant yet challenging problem.

item.title: PromptReps: Prompting Large Language Models to Generate Dense and Sparse Representations for Zero-Shot Document Retrieval
item.description: The current use of large language models (LLMs) for zero-shot document ranking follows one of two ways: 1) prompt-based re-ranking methods, which require no further training but are feasible for only re-ranking a handful of candidate documents due to the associated computational costs; and 2) unsupervised contrastive trained dense retrieval methods, which can retrieve relevant documents from the entire corpus but require a large amount of paired text data for contrastive training.

item.title: Self-supervised learning for classifying paranasal anomalies in the maxillary sinus
item.description: Lastly, we fine-tune the encoder part of the 3D CNN on a labelled dataset of normal and anomalous MS images.

item.title: A Systematic Evaluation of Adversarial Attacks against Speech Emotion Recognition Models
item.description: In summary, this work contributes to the understanding of the robustness of CNN-LSTM models, particularly in SER scenarios, and the impact of AEs.

item.title: M3oE: Multi-Domain Multi-Task Mixture-of Experts Recommendation Framework
item.description: M3oE integrates multi-domain information, maps knowledge across domains and tasks, and optimizes multiple objectives.

item.title: Post-hoc and manifold explanations analysis of facial expression data based on deep learning
item.description: This study not only advances the application of AI technology in the field of psychology but also provides a new psychological theoretical understanding the information processing of the AI.

item.title: Hallucination of Multimodal Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: By drawing the granular classification and landscapes of hallucination causes, evaluation benchmarks, and mitigation methods, this survey aims to deepen the understanding of hallucinations in MLLMs and inspire further advancements in the field.

item.title: LLM-SR: Scientific Equation Discovery via Programming with Large Language Models
item.description: Mathematical equations have been unreasonably effective in describing complex natural phenomena across various scientific disciplines.

item.title: OpenStreetView-5M: The Many Roads to Global Visual Geolocation
item.description: Determining the location of an image anywhere on Earth is a complex visual task, which makes it particularly relevant for evaluating computer vision algorithms.

item.title: A Survey on Vision Mamba: Models, Applications and Challenges
item.description: To help keep pace with the rapid advancements in computer vision, this paper aims to provide a comprehensive review of visual Mamba approaches.

item.title: Predicting Safety Misbehaviours in Autonomous Driving Systems using Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: The automated real-time recognition of unexpected situations plays a crucial role in the safety of autonomous vehicles, especially in unsupported and unpredictable scenarios.

item.title: Human-in-the-Loop Synthetic Text Data Inspection with Provenance Tracking
item.description: INSPECTOR allows users to group related texts by their transformation provenance, i. e., the transformations applied to the original text, or feature provenance, the linguistic features of the original text.

item.title: PECC: Problem Extraction and Coding Challenges
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have showcased their exceptional abilities across various tasks, such as code generation, problem-solving and reasoning.

item.title: WorldGPT: Empowering LLM as Multimodal World Model
item.description: As for evaluation, we build WorldNet, a multimodal state transition prediction benchmark encompassing varied real-life scenarios.

item.title: Deep Boosting Learning: A Brand-new Cooperative Approach for Image-Text Matching
item.description: Specifically, we propose a brand-new Deep Boosting Learning (DBL) algorithm, where an anchor branch is first trained to provide insights into the data properties, with a target branch gaining more advanced knowledge to develop optimal features and distance metrics.

item.title: Snake with Shifted Window: Learning to Adapt Vessel Pattern for OCTA Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we thus study how to use OCTA images with projection vascular layers to segment retinal structures.

item.title: ComposerX: Multi-Agent Symbolic Music Composition with LLMs
item.description: Music composition represents the creative side of humanity, and itself is a complex task that requires abilities to understand and generate information with long dependency and harmony constraints.

item.title: Assessing Image Quality Using a Simple Generative Representation
item.description: Perceptual image quality assessment (IQA) is the task of predicting the visual quality of an image as perceived by a human observer.

item.title: Exploring the Robustness of In-Context Learning with Noisy Labels
item.description: In this paper, inspired by prior research that studies ICL ability using simple function classes, we take a closer look at this problem by investigating the robustness of Transformers against noisy labels.

item.title: SOUL: Unlocking the Power of Second-Order Optimization for LLM Unlearning
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have highlighted the necessity of effective unlearning mechanisms to comply with data regulations and ethical AI practices.

item.title: 4DBInfer: A 4D Benchmarking Toolbox for Graph-Centric Predictive Modeling on Relational DBs
item.description: Although RDBs store vast amounts of rich, informative data spread across interconnected tables, the progress of predictive machine learning models as applied to such tasks arguably falls well behind advances in other domains such as computer vision or natural language processing.

item.title: Prompt Customization for Continual Learning
item.description: In contrast to conventional methods that employ hard prompt selection, PGM assigns different coefficients to prompts from a fixed-sized pool of prompts and generates tailored prompts.

item.title: IMEX-Reg: Implicit-Explicit Regularization in the Function Space for Continual Learning
item.description: To further leverage the global relationship between representations learned using CRL, we propose a regularization strategy to guide the classifier toward the activation correlations in the unit hypersphere of the CRL.

item.title: SAFE-RL: Saliency-Aware Counterfactual Explainer for Deep Reinforcement Learning Policies
item.description: We evaluate the effectiveness of our framework in diverse domains, including ADS, Atari Pong, Pacman and space-invaders games, using traditional performance metrics such as validity, proximity and sparsity.

item.title: L3Cube-MahaNews: News-based Short Text and Long Document Classification Datasets in Marathi
item.description: We conduct a comparative analysis between monolingual and multilingual BERT models, including MahaBERT, IndicBERT, and MuRIL.

item.title: Advancing Supervised Learning with the Wave Loss Function: A Robust and Smooth Approach
item.description: To empirically showcase the effectiveness of the proposed Wave-SVM and Wave-TSVM, we evaluate them on benchmark UCI and KEEL datasets (with and without feature noise) from diverse domains.

item.title: Mamba-FETrack: Frame-Event Tracking via State Space Model
item.description: Specifically, our Mamba-based tracker achieves 43. 5/55. 6 on the SR/PR metric, while the ViT-S based tracker (OSTrack) obtains 40. 0/50. 9.

item.title: Efficient Remote Sensing with Harmonized Transfer Learning and Modality Alignment
item.description: We hope this method can facilitate the efficient application of large models to a wide range of downstream tasks while significantly reducing the resource consumption.

item.title: Ranked List Truncation for Large Language Model-based Re-Ranking
item.description: RLT is crucial for re-ranking as it can improve re-ranking efficiency by sending variable-length candidate lists to a re-ranker on a per-query basis.

item.title: CBMAP: Clustering-based manifold approximation and projection for dimensionality reduction
item.description: Dimensionality reduction methods are employed to decrease data dimensionality, either to enhance machine learning performance or to facilitate data visualization in two or three-dimensional spaces.

item.title: Multi-Stream Cellular Test-Time Adaptation of Real-Time Models Evolving in Dynamic Environments
item.description: In the era of the Internet of Things (IoT), objects connect through a dynamic network, empowered by technologies like 5G, enabling real-time data sharing.

item.title: Random Walk on Pixel Manifolds for Anomaly Segmentation of Complex Driving Scenes
item.description: In anomaly segmentation for complex driving scenes, state-of-the-art approaches utilize anomaly scoring functions to calculate anomaly scores.

item.title: Leveraging Cross-Modal Neighbor Representation for Improved CLIP Classification
item.description: Despite this, some studies have directly used CLIP's image encoder for tasks like few-shot classification, introducing a misalignment between its pre-training objectives and feature extraction methods.

item.title: CLFT: Camera-LiDAR Fusion Transformer for Semantic Segmentation in Autonomous Driving
item.description: Our proposal uses the novel progressive-assemble strategy of vision transformers on a double-direction network and then integrates the results in a cross-fusion strategy over the transformer decoder layers.

item.title: Are Watermarks Bugs for Deepfake Detectors? Rethinking Proactive Forensics
item.description: AI-generated content has accelerated the topic of media synthesis, particularly Deepfake, which can manipulate our portraits for positive or malicious purposes.

item.title: Bounding the Expected Robustness of Graph Neural Networks Subject to Node Feature Attacks
item.description: In this work, we theoretically define the concept of expected robustness in the context of attributed graphs and relate it to the classical definition of adversarial robustness in the graph representation learning literature.
